action.action-desc: Mr. Cicilline (for himself, Mr. Meijer, and Mr. Morelle) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Financial Services

form.official-title: To authorize the Secretary of Commerce to establish the Manufacturing Communities Support Program, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the “Made in America Manufacturing Communities Act of 2022”.

paragraph.text: The term eligible consortium means a consortium that meets the eligibility criteria established by the Secretary under subsection (c)(2)(A).

paragraph.header: Investing in Manufacturing Communities Partnership; IMCP
paragraph.text: The term Investing in Manufacturing Communities Partnership or IMCP means the initiative of the United States Economic Development Association for the purpose of helping communities cultivate an environment for businesses to create well-paying manufacturing jobs in regions across the United States.
The term manufacturing community means an eligible consortium designated by the Secretary under subsection (c)(1).
The term nonprofit organization means an organization exempt from taxation as defined in paragraph (3), (5), or (6) of section 501(c) of the Internal Revenue Code.
The term Program means the Manufacturing Communities Support Program authorized under subsection (b)(1).
The term Secretary means the Secretary of Commerce.
The term small business concern means the term as defined under section 3 of the Small Business Act (15 U.S.C. 632).

Subject to the availability of appropriations, the Secretary shall establish a program to be known as the Manufacturing Communities Support Program, under which the Secretary may designate and support eligible consortiums as manufacturing communities.
The purpose of the Program shall be to strengthen the manufacturing base of the United States by making long-term investments in manufacturing communities by supporting—
Under the Manufacturing Communities Support Program, the Secretary shall designate an eligible consortium as a manufacturing community through a competitive process.

subparagraph.text: The Secretary shall establish criteria for a consortium to be eligible for a designation as a manufacturing community under paragraph (1).
In developing eligibility criteria under subparagraph (A), the Secretary shall consider the merits of—

clause.text: including members from academia, commercial industry, nonprofit organizations, and State and local governmental organizations;

supporting efforts in geographical regions that have capabilities in key technologies or manufacturing base supply chains that the Secretary determines to be critical to codifying the supply chains of the United States; and
the optimal composition and size of a consortium to promote effectiveness, collaboration, and efficiency.

paragraph.text: Each designation under paragraph (1) shall be for a 5-year period.

subparagraph.text: The Secretary may renew a designation made under paragraph (1) for not more than 2 additional 2-year periods.

clause.text: The Secretary shall establish criteria for the renewal of a designation under subparagraph (A).
In establishing criteria for a renewal under clause (i) the Secretary shall consider, with respect to the manufacturing community seeking a renewal—

subclause.text: the performance of the manufacturing community in meeting the established goals of the Program;
the progress the manufacturing community has made with respect to project-specific metrics, particularly with respect to metrics designed to help manufacturing communities track their own progress;

whether any changes to the composition of the manufacturing community or revisions of the plan of the manufacturing community would improve the capabilities of the manufacturing base of the United States; and
any other criteria the Secretary determines appropriate.

subparagraph.text: An eligible consortium seeking a designation under paragraph (1) shall submit an application to the Secretary at such time and in such manner as the Secretary may require.
In developing application procedures under subparagraph (A), the Secretary shall consider the inclusion of, with respect to an eligible consortium—

clause.text: a description of the regional boundaries of the eligible consortium and the manufacturing capacity of the region;
an evidence-based plan for enhancing the manufacturing base in the United States through the efforts of the eligible consortium;
the investments the eligible consortium proposes and the strategy of the eligible consortium to address gaps in the manufacturing base of the United States;
a description of the outcome-based metrics, benchmarks, and milestones that will track and the evaluation methods that will be used to gauge performance of the eligible consortium;
a plan to ensure that members of the eligible consortium are representative of the proposed location of the manufacturing community;
a community that had previously received a designation by the IMCP; and
any other matters the Secretary determines appropriate.

subparagraph.text: The Secretary shall provide strategic planning assistance for eligible consortiums that lack experience applying for Federal assistance to ensure such eligible consortiums may submit an application that meets the procedures established by the Secretary under this paragraph.

paragraph.text: As appropriate and for purposes of the Program, the Secretary may award financial or technical assistance to a member of an eligible consortium that has been designated as a manufacturing community.

A recipient of financial or technical assistance under paragraph (1) shall use the financial or technical assistance to support an investment that will improve the manufacturing base of the United States.
Investments supported under this subsection may include activities relating to—

subparagraph.text: workforce training, retraining, or recruitment and retention, including for women, underrepresented minorities, and veterans (as such term is defined in section 101 of title 38, United States Code);
advanced research and commercialization, including with Federal laboratories and depots;

subsection.text: The Secretary may make a Federal point of contact available to each eligible consortium designated as a manufacturing community to help such consortium and the members of such consortium access Federal financial and technical assistance.
The Secretary may accept amounts transferred to the Secretary from the head of an agency or a State or local governmental organization to carry out this section.

Not later than 6 years after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Secretary shall submit to the Congress, and make publicly available, a report that identifies the best practices for an eligible consortium—

paragraph.text: to be designated as a manufacturing community; and
to renew the manufacturing community designation.
